questions.text: I find that I brainstorm best by discussing my ideas with others
I like to pack my weekends with social engagements
I feel at ease in big cities
I find it thrilling to meet new people and learn about their experiences
I find it easy to be vulnerable with others
I often make new connections at events or outings
After a long day, I often need to recharge by watching TV, reading a book, or playing video games
I don't mind going to a museum or nice restaurant on my own
My friends would describe me as 'reflective.'
I find it easy to get caught up in my own thoughts and zone out from the world around me
I prefer to spend time with friends one-on-one rather than in a large group
I prefer to work in a personal office or library rather than in a cafe or lounge
I enjoy thinking through theoretical ideas and frameworks
I thrive on solving new problems
I often find that metaphors and symbols resonate with me
I often think about humankind and its destiny
I tend to think about the root cause for phenomena
I work best with managers who give clear and prescriptive instructions
Experience is a better indicator of future success than creativity
I learn best from hands-on experience
I prefer to learn practical and applied skills
xx
I try to use logical and impartial criteria to make a decision
It is more important to be truthful than tactful
I can be perceived as 'stubborn' or 'strong-headed'
I often weigh the pros and cons of a decision before I make it
I enjoy fields like engineering and science with clear, objective criteria
I am not easily swayed by others' wishes
A key to a successful meeting is being able to read a room
I am diplomatic
When friends are going through a tough time, I tend to offer sympathy rather than advice
I think compassion is more important than justice
I tend to compromise easily if it helps maintain harmony
I find it easy to understand others' experiences and motivations
I like to carefully plan vacations
I like to build routines
I work in bursts of energy
I think thorough planning is likely to ruin a good vacation
I prefer to keep my options open
